segment.source: Add and Remove Computers (Windows 10)
segment.target: Add and Remove Computers (Windows 10)

segment.source: Add and Remove Computers
segment.target: Add and Remove Computers

segment.source: Add and Remove Computers
segment.target: Add and Remove Computers

segment.source: You can add computers that have any of the supported Windows or Office products installed to a Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) database by using the Discover products function.
segment.target: You can add computers that have any of the supported Windows or Office products installed to a Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) database by using the Discover products function.

segment.source: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general LDAP query.
segment.target: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general LDAP query.

segment.source: You can remove computers from a VAMT database by using the Delete function.
segment.target: You can remove computers from a VAMT database by using the Delete function.

segment.source: After you add the computers, you can add the products that are installed on the computers by running the Update license status function.
segment.target: After you add the computers, you can add the products that are installed on the computers by running the Update license status function.

segment.source: Before adding computers, ensure that the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) firewall exception required by VAMT has been enabled on all target computers.
segment.target: Before adding computers, ensure that the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) firewall exception required by VAMT has been enabled on all target computers.

segment.source: For more information see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: To add computers to a VAMT database
segment.target: To add computers to a VAMT database

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: Click Discover products in the Actions menu in the right-side pane to open the Discover Products dialog box.
segment.target: Click Discover products in the Actions menu in the right-side pane to open the Discover Products dialog box.

segment.source: In the Discover products dialog box, click Search for computers in the Active Directory to display the search options, then click the search option you want to use.
segment.target: In the Discover products dialog box, click Search for computers in the Active Directory to display the search options, then click the search option you want to use.

segment.source: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general LDAP query.
segment.target: You can search for computers in an Active Directory domain, by individual computer name or IP address, in a workgroup, or by a general LDAP query.

segment.source: To search for computers in an Active Directory domain, click Search for computers in the Active Directory, then under Domain Filter Criteria, in the list of domain names click the name of the domain you want to search.
segment.target: To search for computers in an Active Directory domain, click Search for computers in the Active Directory, then under Domain Filter Criteria, in the list of domain names click the name of the domain you want to search.

segment.source: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer within the domain.
segment.target: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer within the domain.

segment.source: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.
segment.target: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.

segment.source: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".
segment.target: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".

segment.source: To search by individual computer name or IP address, click Manually enter name or IP address, then enter the full name or IP address in the One or more computer names or IP addresses separated by commas text box.
segment.target: To search by individual computer name or IP address, click Manually enter name or IP address, then enter the full name or IP address in the One or more computer names or IP addresses separated by commas text box.

segment.source: Separate multiple entries with a comma.
segment.target: Separate multiple entries with a comma.

segment.source: Note that VAMT supports both IPv4 and IPV6 addressing.
segment.target: Note that VAMT supports both IPv4 and IPV6 addressing.

segment.source: To search for computers in a workgroup, click Search for computers in the workgroup, then under Workgroup Filter Criteria, in the list of workgroup names click the name of the workgroup you want to search.
segment.target: To search for computers in a workgroup, click Search for computers in the workgroup, then under Workgroup Filter Criteria, in the list of workgroup names click the name of the workgroup you want to search.

segment.source: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer within the workgroup.
segment.target: You can narrow the search further by typing a name in the Filter by computer name field to search for a specific computer within the workgroup.

segment.source: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.
segment.target: This filter supports the asterisk () wildcard.

segment.source: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".
segment.target: For example, typing "a" will display only computer names that start with the letter "a".

segment.source: To search for computers by using a general LDAP query, click Search with LDAP query and enter your query in the text box provided.
segment.target: To search for computers by using a general LDAP query, click Search with LDAP query and enter your query in the text box provided.

segment.source: VAMT will validate only the LDAP query syntax, but will otherwise run the query without further checks.
segment.target: VAMT will validate only the LDAP query syntax, but will otherwise run the query without further checks.

segment.source: Click Search.
segment.target: Click Search.

segment.source: VAMT searches for the specified computers and adds them to the VAMT database.
segment.target: VAMT searches for the specified computers and adds them to the VAMT database.

segment.source: During the search, VAMT displays the Finding computers message shown below.
segment.target: During the search, VAMT displays the Finding computers message shown below.

segment.source: To cancel the search, click Cancel.
segment.target: To cancel the search, click Cancel.

segment.source: When the search is complete the names of the newly-discovered computers appear in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the search is complete the names of the newly-discovered computers appear in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: VAMT, Finding computers dialog box
segment.target: VAMT, Finding computers dialog box

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This step adds only the computers to the VAMT database, and not the products that are installed on the computers.
segment.target: This step adds only the computers to the VAMT database, and not the products that are installed on the computers.

segment.source: To add the products, you need to run the Update license status function.
segment.target: To add the products, you need to run the Update license status function.

segment.source: To add products to VAMT
segment.target: To add products to VAMT

segment.source: In the Products list, select the computers that need to have their product information added to the VAMT database.
segment.target: In the Products list, select the computers that need to have their product information added to the VAMT database.

segment.source: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.
segment.target: You can use the Filter function to narrow your search for computers by clicking Filter in the right-side pane to open the Filter Products dialog box.

segment.source: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.
segment.target: In the Filter Products dialog box, you can filter the list by computer name, product name, product key type, license status, or by any combination of these options.

segment.source: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.
segment.target: To filter the list by computer name, enter a name in the Computer Name box.

segment.source: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.
segment.target: To filter the list by Product Name, Product Key Type, or License Status, click the list you want to use for the filter and select an option.

segment.source: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.
segment.target: If necessary, click clear all filters to create a new filter.

segment.source: Click Filter.
segment.target: Click Filter.

segment.source: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.
segment.target: VAMT displays the filtered list in the center pane.

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status and then click a credential option.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status and then click a credential option.

segment.source: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you used to log into the computer.
segment.target: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you used to log into the computer.

segment.source: If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.
segment.target: If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the licensing status of all supported products on the selected computers.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the licensing status of all supported products on the selected computers.

segment.source: When the process is finished, the updated licensing status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the process is finished, the updated licensing status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a computer has more than one supported product installed, VAMT adds an entry for each product.
segment.target: If a computer has more than one supported product installed, VAMT adds an entry for each product.

segment.source: The entry appears under the appropriate product heading.
segment.target: The entry appears under the appropriate product heading.

segment.source: To remove computers from a VAMT database
segment.target: To remove computers from a VAMT database

segment.source: You can delete a computer by clicking on it in the product list view, and then clicking Delete in the Selected Item menu in the right-hand pane.
segment.target: You can delete a computer by clicking on it in the product list view, and then clicking Delete in the Selected Item menu in the right-hand pane.

segment.source: In the Confirm Delete Selected Products dialog box that appears, click Yes to delete the computer.
segment.target: In the Confirm Delete Selected Products dialog box that appears, click Yes to delete the computer.

segment.source: If a computer has multiple products listed, you must delete each product to completely remove the computer from the VAMT database.
segment.target: If a computer has multiple products listed, you must delete each product to completely remove the computer from the VAMT database.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Add and Manage Products
segment.target: Add and Manage Products
